title: Johnstown Flood National Memorial: Education
body: The Great Johnstown Flood Johnstown Flood National Memorial invites students and teachers to explore the park on a ranger led field trip. The field trip addresses Concepts identified in both the Pennsylvania Standards Aligned System for History, Geography and Science and Mathematics subjects and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) in grades third through sixth. Click here to learn more, to make reservations, and for fee information.                 Scheduling a Field Trip To schedule a field trip, please contact Acting Chief of Interpretation Doug Bosley at either Doug_Bosley@nps.gov or (814) 886-6162. Read More        Take a Hike! Your students can be lead on a hike through the remains of the South Fork Dam. They will learn history, but also math and science! Read More        An Interview with Colonel Elias J.
